tasks.title: Backend: Add base64 image upload endpoint for aura scanning
tasks.description:
CRITICAL: The mobile app sends a local file URI (e.g., file:///var/mobile/.../photo.jpg) as image_url to POST /aura/scan, but the OpenAI Vision API needs either a real URL or base64 data. The backend must accept base64-encoded image data.

File: backend/internal/dto/aura.go
- Change CreateAuraRequest to accept `image_data` (base64 string) instead of `image_url` (URL). Add field: ImageData string `json:"image_data" validate:"required"`. Remove the URL validation on image_url or make it optional.

File: backend/internal/services/aura_service.go
- In the Create() method (~line 163), check if req.ImageData is provided. If so, use it as the base64 content for the OpenAI Vision API call.
- In callOpenAIVision(), change the image_url content part to use a base64 data URI: `data:image/jpeg;base64,<image_data>` format instead of a URL. OpenAI Vision API supports base64 via: {"type":"image_url","image_url":{"url":"data:image/jpeg;base64,..."}}.
- Store a placeholder string like "base64_upload" in the ImageURL model field since the original image doesn't need to be stored long-term.
- Keep the existing URL path as fallback for backwards compatibility.

File: backend/internal/handlers/aura_handler.go
- Update Scan handler to support larger body sizes. The main.go already sets BodyLimit to 4MB which is sufficient for compressed selfies.
- Add request body size validation: reject if image_data exceeds 3MB base64 (roughly 2.25MB image).

This unblocks the entire scan flow — without this change, OpenAI gets a local file:// URI it cannot access.

tasks.title: Mobile: Send base64 image data instead of file URI in scan flow
tasks.description:
CRITICAL: The mobile app currently sends `image_url: result.assets[0].uri` (a local file:// path) to POST /aura/scan. The backend cannot forward a local URI to OpenAI. Must convert the image to base64 before sending.

File: mobile/app/(protected)/home.tsx
- Import `* as FileSystem` from 'expo-file-system' (already in package.json via expo).
- In handleScan(), after ImagePicker returns a result, read the file as base64:
  ```
  const base64 = await FileSystem.readAsStringAsync(result.assets[0].uri, {
    encoding: FileSystem.EncodingType.Base64,
  });
  ```
- Change the API call from `api.post('/aura/scan', { image_url: result.assets[0].uri })` to `api.post('/aura/scan', { image_data: base64 })`.
- Remove the artificial 2500ms mock delay (`await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 2500))` at line 86). The real OpenAI API call takes 2-5 seconds naturally — no fake delay needed.
- Add a scanning state message: while isScanning is true, show a text like "Reading your energy..." below the ScanButton. Use an animated opacity pulse (Reanimated useSharedValue with withRepeat/withTiming from 0.4 to 1.0, 1s duration).
- Keep quality: 0.7 in ImagePicker config to keep base64 size reasonable (<1MB).

File: mobile/lib/api.ts
- Increase axios timeout from 15000 to 30000ms to accommodate OpenAI Vision API processing time (can take 5-15 seconds for image analysis).

tasks.title: Mobile: Add 3-screen onboarding flow with AsyncStorage tracking
tasks.description:
The app currently has NO onboarding — users go directly to login. Must add a 3-screen onboarding flow that shows only on first launch.

File: mobile/app/onboarding.tsx (CREATE)
- Use useState for currentPage (0, 1, 2). Render each page as a full-screen View.
- Page 0 (Welcome): Large AuraOrb component (size 180) with color='violet', title "Discover Your Aura" in text-3xl font-bold text-white, subtitle "Your energy tells a story. Let's read it together." in text-base text-gray-400 text-center, bg-gray-950.
- Page 1 (Features): Three feature rows with icons (sparkles/camera/people from Ionicons, size 32, color #8b5cf6/#22c55e/#ec4899), titles ("AI-Powered Analysis"/"Selfie Scanning"/"Friend Matching"), descriptions. Each row: flex-row items-center mx-8 my-4 with icon in h-16 w-16 rounded-full bg-violet-600/20 items-center justify-center.
- Page 2 (CTA): Large sparkles icon, title "Ready to Begin?", two buttons: "Try Free" (bg-violet-600 rounded-full py-4 mx-8) calls handleGuestStart, "Sign In" (border border-gray-600 rounded-full py-4 mx-8 mt-3) navigates to /(auth)/login.
- Page indicator: 3 dots at bottom (h-2 w-2 rounded-full, active: bg-violet-500, inactive: bg-gray-600, mx-1).
- Navigation: "Next" button (right arrow) on pages 0-1, swipeable via ScrollView with pagingEnabled and horizontal.
- On completion: `await AsyncStorage.setItem('onboarding_complete', 'true')` then navigate.
- handleGuestStart: sets `await AsyncStorage.setItem('guest_mode', 'true')` and navigates to /(protected)/home.

File: mobile/app/index.tsx (MODIFY)
- Import AsyncStorage from '@react-native-async-storage/async-storage'.
- Before auth check, check `const onboarded = await AsyncStorage.getItem('onboarding_complete')`. If not onboarded, redirect to /onboarding.
- After onboarding check, check `const isGuest = await AsyncStorage.getItem('guest_mode')`. If guest and not authenticated, redirect to /(protected)/home.

File: mobile/app/_layout.tsx (MODIFY)
- Add 'onboarding' to the Stack.Screen list so the route works.

Note: AsyncStorage is available via '@react-native-async-storage/async-storage' which is a dependency of expo-router.

tasks.title: Mobile: Add guest mode with 3-free-scan counter and upgrade prompts
tasks.description:
The app requires authentication for ALL features. Must allow 3 free scans without login.

File: mobile/contexts/AuthContext.tsx (MODIFY)
- Add `isGuest: boolean` to AuthContextType and state. Initialize by checking `AsyncStorage.getItem('guest_mode')`.
- Add `enterGuestMode()` method: sets `AsyncStorage.setItem('guest_mode', 'true')`, sets isGuest=true.
- Add `getGuestScansRemaining()`: reads `AsyncStorage.getItem('guest_scan_count')`, returns 3 minus count (or 3 if null).
- Add `incrementGuestScan()`: reads current count, increments, saves to AsyncStorage. Returns new remaining count.
- Export isGuest in context value.

File: mobile/app/(protected)/_layout.tsx (MODIFY)
- Change the auth guard: instead of `if (!isAuthenticated) return <Redirect>`, check `if (!isAuthenticated && !isGuest) return <Redirect href="/(auth)/login" />`.
- Import isGuest from AuthContext.

File: mobile/app/(protected)/home.tsx (MODIFY)
- Import `useAuth` and get `isGuest, isAuthenticated, getGuestScansRemaining, incrementGuestScan`.
- Before handleScan API call, if isGuest: check remaining scans via getGuestScansRemaining(). If 0, show Alert with title "Free Scans Used" message "Create an account to keep scanning!" and buttons ["Sign Up" → router.push('/(auth)/register'), "Cancel"]. Return early.
- After successful scan (if guest), call incrementGuestScan().
- Show remaining scans badge for guests: a small pill below the scan button showing "{remaining} free scans left" in text-xs text-violet-400 with bg-violet-600/20 rounded-full px-3 py-1.
- For guest users, hide the Quick Actions "Compare with Friend" card (match requires auth).

File: mobile/app/(auth)/login.tsx (MODIFY)
- Add a "Skip for now" link below the Sign Up link. Style: text-gray-400 text-sm mt-4 text-center. On press: call enterGuestMode() from AuthContext then router.replace('/(protected)/home').

tasks.title: Mobile: Redesign auth screens with dark theme and gradient accents
tasks.description:
Login and register screens use a plain white background that clashes with the dark-themed protected screens. Must unify the design.

File: mobile/app/(auth)/login.tsx (MODIFY)
- Change outer KeyboardAvoidingView className from 'flex-1 bg-white' to 'flex-1 bg-gray-950'.
- Add a hero section at top: View with items-center, containing an AuraOrb (import from components/aura/AuraOrb) with color='violet' and size={100}, then app name "AuraSnap" in text-2xl font-bold text-white mt-4, tagline "Discover your energy" in text-sm text-gray-400.
- Change title "Welcome back" from text-gray-900 to text-white.
- Change subtitle from text-gray-500 to text-gray-400.
- Change error box from bg-red-50 to bg-red-900/30 rounded-xl, error text from text-red-600 to text-red-400.
- Update Input components: the Input component already handles dark mode if placeholderTextColor is set. Ensure the Input label text is text-gray-300 and input bg is bg-gray-800.
- Change Button primary variant to use bg-violet-600 instead of bg-primary-600 (which may not resolve in NativeWind).
- Change "Don't have an account?" text from text-gray-500 to text-gray-400.
- Change "Sign Up" link from text-primary-600 to text-violet-400 font-semibold.

File: mobile/app/(auth)/register.tsx (MODIFY)
- Apply same dark theme changes: bg-gray-950, text-white titles, text-gray-400 subtitles, bg-red-900/30 error box, text-violet-400 links.
- Add AuraOrb hero at top matching login screen.

File: mobile/components/ui/Input.tsx (MODIFY)
- Update default styling: change bg-white to bg-gray-800, border-gray-300 to border-gray-700, text color to text-white, label to text-gray-300.
- Focus border: change to border-violet-500.

File: mobile/components/ui/Button.tsx (MODIFY)
- Update primary variant: change bg-blue-600/bg-primary-600 to bg-violet-600. active:bg-violet-700.
- Update text for primary: ensure text-white.
- Add hapticLight() import and call on press for all buttons.

tasks.title: Mobile: Enhance aura detail screen with shareable gradient card
tasks.description:
The aura detail screen (aura/[id].tsx) needs a polished shareable result card with gradient background, and the share feature should capture it as an image.

File: mobile/app/(protected)/aura/[id].tsx (MODIFY)
- Add a visually rich result card section wrapped in a View with ref (for future screenshot capture).
- Above the AuraOrb, add a gradient-like header using nested Views: outermost View with rounded-3xl overflow-hidden, an inner View with the aura's color as bg (use the existing colorMap), opacity-20, absolute fill. This creates a colored card effect.
- Card layout: AuraOrb centered (size 160), aura color label below in text-2xl font-bold text-white text-center, secondary color as a small pill badge (if present) with bg-{color}/20 rounded-full px-3 py-1 text-xs.
- Stats row below card: two stat boxes side by side — Energy (flash icon + level%) and Mood (emoji + score/10). Each in flex-1 items-center rounded-xl bg-gray-800/50 p-4.
- Personality section: keep PersonalityCard but add a subtle top border (border-t border-gray-800 pt-6 mt-6).
- Share button: change from simple text share to generating a formatted share message that includes:
  ```
  ✨ My AuraSnap Reading ✨
  
  🔮 {COLOR} Aura — {label}
  ⚡ Energy: {level}% | 🎭 Mood: {score}/10
  
  💫 {personality snippet first 100 chars}...
  
  Download AuraSnap to discover YOUR aura! 🌈
  ```
- Add a "Compare with Friend" CTA button below share: bg-pink-600 rounded-full py-4, navigates to /match.
- Add hapticSuccess() when the detail screen finishes loading.

File: mobile/components/aura/AuraOrb.tsx (MODIFY)
- Add an optional `label` prop (string). If provided, render the label centered below the orb in text-sm font-medium text-gray-300.

tasks.title: Backend: Add image upload endpoint with multipart form support
tasks.description:
Alternative robust approach: Instead of base64 in JSON body, add a dedicated multipart file upload endpoint that stores the image temporarily and passes it to OpenAI.

File: backend/internal/handlers/aura_handler.go (MODIFY)
- Add a new handler method ScanWithUpload(c *fiber.Ctx) that accepts multipart/form-data.
- Extract file from form: `file, err := c.FormFile("image")`. Validate: must be image/jpeg or image/png, max 4MB.
- Read file content into memory: open file, read bytes, encode to base64.
- Create a CreateAuraRequest with the base64 data and call auraService.Create().
- Return 201 with the aura reading response.

File: backend/internal/routes/routes.go (MODIFY)
- Add new route: `aura.Post("/scan/upload", auraHandler.ScanWithUpload)` — this keeps backward compatibility with the existing /scan endpoint.

File: backend/internal/services/aura_service.go (MODIFY)
- Ensure the Create method and callOpenAIVision support receiving base64 image data.
- In callOpenAIVision, when imageURL starts with "data:image" or is pure base64, use the data URI format for OpenAI: {"type":"image_url","image_url":{"url":"data:image/jpeg;base64,<data>","detail":"low"}}.
- Use "detail":"low" to reduce token cost (OpenAI charges per image tile — low detail uses 1 tile = ~85 tokens vs high detail = many tiles).
- If imageURL is a regular https:// URL, pass it directly (backward compatible).

This provides TWO paths for the mobile app: JSON with base64, or multipart upload. The multipart approach is more standard for mobile apps and handles larger images better.

tasks.title: Mobile: Add pull-to-refresh on home screen and improve empty/loading states
tasks.description:
Home screen lacks pull-to-refresh and has minimal loading/empty states. Must polish for App Store quality.

File: mobile/app/(protected)/home.tsx (MODIFY)

1. ADD Pull-to-Refresh:
- Import { RefreshControl } from 'react-native'.
- Add `const [refreshing, setRefreshing] = useState(false);`
- Add onRefresh callback: `setRefreshing(true); await Promise.all([fetchTodayAura(), fetchStreak()]); setRefreshing(false);`
- Add refreshControl prop to ScrollView: `<RefreshControl refreshing={refreshing} onRefresh={onRefresh} tintColor="#8b5cf6" />`

2. IMPROVE Loading State:
- When isLoading is true (initial load), instead of showing nothing, show a skeleton-like layout:
  - A View with items-center mt-20 containing: AuraOrb (color='violet', size=120) with animated opacity (useSharedValue, withRepeat, withTiming 0.3→1.0, 1.5s), text "Loading your aura..." in text-gray-400 mt-4.
  - Import Animated from 'react-native-reanimated' and use animatedStyle.

3. IMPROVE Empty State (when no todayAura and not loading):
- Below the ScanButton, add an informational section:
  - View className="mx-6 mt-10 items-center".
  - Text "Your Daily Aura Awaits" in text-lg font-semibold text-white.
  - Text "Take a selfie and our AI will analyze your energy, mood, and personality." in text-sm text-gray-400 text-center mt-2 mx-4.
  - Three benefit icons in a row (mt-6, flex-row, justify-center, space-x-6): camera ("Selfie"), sparkles ("AI Analysis"), share ("Share"). Each: items-center, icon in h-10 w-10 rounded-full bg-gray-800 items-center justify-center, label in text-xs text-gray-500 mt-1.

4. ADD Greeting based on time of day:
- Replace static "Discover your energy today" subtitle with dynamic greeting:
  ```
  const hour = new Date().getHours();
  const greeting = hour < 12 ? 'Good morning' : hour < 18 ? 'Good afternoon' : 'Good evening';
  ```
- Show: `{greeting} ✨` in text-gray-400.

tasks.title: Mobile: Improve match screen UX with user ID display and copy button
tasks.description:
The match screen requires manual entry of a UUID friend ID which is terrible UX. Must add a way for users to find and share their own ID.

File: mobile/app/(protected)/match.tsx (MODIFY)

1. SHOW Current User's ID:
- Import `useAuth` from '../../contexts/AuthContext'. Get `user` from context.
- Above the friend ID input, add a "Your ID" card:
  - View className="mx-6 mt-8 rounded-2xl bg-gray-800/50 p-4".
  - Row: Ionicons name="person-circle" size={24} color="#8b5cf6", Text "Your ID" in text-sm text-gray-400 ml-2.
  - Below: Text with user.id in text-xs text-white font-mono (first 8 chars + "..." + last 4 chars for display).
  - Copy button: TouchableOpacity with Ionicons name="copy-outline" that calls `Clipboard.setStringAsync(user.id)` from 'expo-clipboard' (already available in Expo). Show hapticSuccess() and briefly change icon to checkmark for 2 seconds.
  - Text "Share this ID with friends so they can match with you" in text-xs text-gray-500 mt-2.

2. ADD Share My ID button:
- Below the copy button row, add a TouchableOpacity:
  - className="flex-row items-center justify-center bg-violet-600/20 rounded-full py-2 mt-3"
  - Ionicons name="share-outline" + "Share My ID" text.
  - On press: Share.share({ message: `Match auras with me on AuraSnap! My ID: ${user?.id}` }).

3. IMPROVE Friend ID Input:
- Add paste button inside the TextInput (absolute right-4): Ionicons name="clipboard-outline" that reads from clipboard and sets friendId.
- Add input validation: show red border if text is entered but not a valid UUID format (use regex /^[0-9a-f]{8}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{4}-[0-9a-f]{12}$/i).

4. ADD ActivityIndicator during loading:
- When isLoading, show a full-screen overlay with ActivityIndicator and "Analyzing compatibility..." text, not just button text change.

tasks.title: Mobile: Add premium gating for unlimited scans and match features
tasks.description:
Currently all features are completely ungated — premium subscription has zero effect on feature access. Must enforce subscription tiers.

File: mobile/app/(protected)/home.tsx (MODIFY)
- Import useSubscription from '../../contexts/SubscriptionContext'.
- Get `isSubscribed` from context.
- In handleScan, after camera permission check and before API call:
  - If NOT authenticated (guest mode), check guest scan counter (from enhance_005).
  - If authenticated but NOT subscribed, check daily scan count. Store today's count in state, fetch from backend via GET /aura/today. If today's aura already exists, allow 1 re-scan (total 2/day for free). If they've scanned twice today and not subscribed, show Alert: "Daily Limit Reached" / "Free users get 2 scans per day. Upgrade to Premium for unlimited scans!" / buttons: ["Upgrade" → router.push('/paywall'), "OK"].
  - If subscribed, allow unlimited scans.

File: mobile/app/(protected)/match.tsx (MODIFY)
- Import useSubscription.
- In handleMatch, before API call, if !isSubscribed: show Alert "Premium Feature" / "Aura compatibility matching is a premium feature." / buttons: ["Upgrade" → router.push('/paywall'), "Cancel"]. Return early.
- Add a lock icon overlay on the match input section for non-subscribers with text "Premium Feature" and an "Unlock" button.

File: mobile/app/(protected)/history.tsx (MODIFY)
- Import useSubscription.
- For non-subscribers, limit the displayed readings to the 5 most recent. Show a "View All — Go Premium" card after the 5th item in ReadingList:
  - View with bg-violet-900/30 rounded-xl p-4 items-center.
  - Lock icon + "See your full aura history" text.
  - "Upgrade" button → router.push('/paywall').

File: mobile/app/(protected)/settings.tsx (MODIFY)
- If isSubscribed, show a "Premium Member" badge next to the user email with a sparkles icon and text-violet-400 text.

tasks.title: Mobile: Polish paywall screen with animated feature cards and pricing
tasks.description:
The paywall screen works with RevenueCat but has minimal visual appeal. Must make it conversion-optimized.

File: mobile/app/(protected)/paywall.tsx (MODIFY)

1. REDESIGN Header:
- Replace generic header with a dark gradient hero: bg-gray-950 with a large AuraOrb (import from components/aura/AuraOrb, color='violet', size=120) centered at top.
- Title: "Unlock Your Full Aura" in text-3xl font-bold text-white text-center.
- Subtitle: "See what your energy reveals" in text-base text-gray-400 text-center mt-2.

2. REDESIGN Feature List:
- Instead of plain text list, use animated cards. Each feature in a View className="flex-row items-center mx-6 my-2 bg-gray-800/50 rounded-xl p-4":
  - Left: colored icon circle (h-10 w-10 rounded-full bg-{color}/20 items-center justify-center).
  - Features with icons: "Unlimited Scans" (sparkles, violet), "AI Compatibility" (people, pink), "Full History" (time, green), "Rare Aura Colors" (color-palette, amber), "No Ads" (eye-off, blue), "Priority Analysis" (flash, orange).
  - Right: Ionicons name="checkmark-circle" size={20} color="#22c55e".

3. REDESIGN Package Cards:
- For each RevenueCat package, create a selectable card:
  - View className="mx-6 my-2 rounded-2xl border-2 p-5" with border-violet-500 if selected, border-gray-700 if not.
  - Show package title (e.g., "Monthly"), price (e.g., "$4.99/mo"), and savings badge for annual ("Save 33%" in bg-green-500 rounded-full px-2 py-0.5 text-xs text-white).
  - Selected state: add a checkmark circle in top-right corner.
- "Most Popular" badge on monthly package.

4. FIX Purchase Button:
- Large "Start Free Trial" button at bottom: bg-violet-600 rounded-full py-4 mx-6.
- Below: "Restore Purchases" as text-only button in text-violet-400.
- Below: Subscription terms in text-xs text-gray-500 text-center: "Cancel anytime. Subscription automatically renews unless cancelled at least 24 hours before the end of the current period."

5. ADD Close Button:
- Top-right X button (Ionicons name="close" size={24} color="#9ca3af") to dismiss paywall. router.back().

tasks.title: Backend: Add daily scan rate limiting and user profile endpoint
tasks.description:
Backend has no per-user rate limiting on aura scans and no profile endpoint. Must add these for the mobile gating to work properly.

File: backend/internal/services/aura_service.go (MODIFY)
- Add method `GetTodayCount(userID uuid.UUID) (int64, error)`: count AuraReadings where user_id = userID AND created_at between today 00:00 and 23:59. Return count.
- Add method `CanScan(userID uuid.UUID, isSubscribed bool) (bool, int, error)`: returns (allowed bool, remaining int, error). Logic: if isSubscribed, always return (true, -1, nil) meaning unlimited. If not subscribed, check GetTodayCount — if count < 2, return (true, 2-count-1, nil). If count >= 2, return (false, 0, nil).

File: backend/internal/dto/aura.go (MODIFY)
- Add ScanEligibilityResponse struct: `CanScan bool, Remaining int, IsSubscribed bool`.

File: backend/internal/handlers/aura_handler.go (MODIFY)
- Add handler method `CheckScanEligibility(c *fiber.Ctx)`: extracts userID, checks subscription status via DB query on Subscription model (status = 'active'), calls auraService.CanScan(), returns ScanEligibilityResponse.
- In the existing Scan handler, add a pre-check: call CanScan before processing. If not allowed, return 429 with message "Daily scan limit reached. Upgrade to Premium for unlimited scans."

File: backend/internal/routes/routes.go (MODIFY)
- Add route: `aura.Get("/scan/check", auraHandler.CheckScanEligibility)` — mobile app can call this to check before opening camera.

File: backend/internal/handlers/auth_handler.go (MODIFY)
- Add `GetProfile(c *fiber.Ctx)` handler: returns user email, ID, subscription status, and current streak info. Query User + latest Subscription + latest AuraStreak.

File: backend/internal/routes/routes.go (MODIFY)
- Add route: `auth.Get("/profile", authHandler.GetProfile)` in the protected group.

tasks.title: Mobile: Add animated scan result reveal with confetti-style celebration
tasks.description:
After scanning, users are silently navigated to aura/[id]. Must add an exciting reveal animation.

File: mobile/app/(protected)/aura/[id].tsx (MODIFY)

1. ADD Reveal Animation on Mount:
- Import { useSharedValue, withTiming, withDelay, withSpring, Easing } from 'react-native-reanimated' and Animated from 'react-native-reanimated'.
- Create shared values: `orbScale` (starts at 0), `contentOpacity` (starts at 0), `orbY` (starts at -50).
- On data load complete, trigger sequence:
  - orbScale: withSpring(1, { damping: 12, stiffness: 100 }) — bouncy entrance.
  - orbY: withSpring(0, { damping: 15 }) — slides down into position.
  - contentOpacity: withDelay(600, withTiming(1, { duration: 500 })) — content fades in after orb.
- Wrap AuraOrb in Animated.View with animatedStyle using orbScale transform and orbY translateY.
- Wrap content below orb in Animated.View with animatedStyle using contentOpacity.

2. ADD Color Name Reveal:
- After orb animation completes, show the aura color name with a typewriter-like effect:
  - Use useState to track displayedChars, useEffect with setInterval (50ms per char) to increment from 0 to full length.
  - Show `colorLabel.substring(0, displayedChars)` with a blinking cursor (| character that toggles opacity every 500ms).

3. ADD Celebration Particles:
- Create 8-12 small circles (h-2 w-2 rounded-full) with random positions around the orb.
- Each particle: Animated.View with shared values for translateX, translateY, opacity, scale.
- On mount: particles expand outward (translateX/Y randomized -100 to +100) while fading (opacity 1→0 over 1.5s).
- Colors match the aura color and white.

4. ADD Haptic Sequence:
- On reveal start: hapticMedium().
- After 600ms (content reveal): hapticSuccess().
- Use setTimeout for the delayed haptic.

This creates a memorable "wow moment" that encourages sharing and repeat usage.
